title: Correction to PPI Article
text:
Prices that businesses receive for their goods and services unexpectedly fell in September, potentially dealing a setback to the Federal Reserve's hopes of hitting its inflation target in coming quarters.

The producer-price index typically tracks the same broad trends as other inflation measures, though it does not always translate into what consumers pay. Economists and investors will get their first glimpse at prices paid in September by the average American on Thursday, when the Labor Department releases the consumer-price index.

"US Producer Prices Unexpectedly Drop in September," at 8:45 a.m. ET, misstated the month in the first paragraph and omitted the month for the CPI data in the fourth paragraph.

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 08, 2019 08:57 ET (12:57 GMT)
